ch.supertomcat.bh.pic

Class Pic

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.supertomcat.bh.pic.Pic
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDownloadListener, java.lang.Runnable

    public class Pic
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable, IDownloadListener
    Thread which does the download This class is called Pic, because it is an shortcut for Picture. And as is started programming this program it was only for downloading pictures. But this class can not only download pictures, all kind of files can be downloaded. And no, i'm not willing to rename this class ;-)

      • startDownload

      • stopDownload

        public void stopDownload()
        Stop the download This does not immediately stop the download, it only changes the stop-flag to true and the download method will stop if this flag is true. When the download is waiting for the parsed URL, this could take some time...

      • downloadAllowed

        public boolean downloadAllowed()
        Description copied from interface: IDownloadListener
        Allows a Pic to start the download The Pic should then return true, if it has really started the pic or false if not. If it does return a wrong value, QueueData would start too many downloads or would not increase the counter and would not increase the slots used.
        Specified by:
        downloadAllowed in interface IDownloadListener
        Returns:
        True/False

      • createDirectory

        public static java.lang.String createDirectory(java.io.File dir,
                               java.lang.String targetPath)
        Creates a directory If there is already a file of the same name, a number is added at the end of the foldername. This method returns a File-Object which contains path. If the directory could not be created null is returned
        Parameters:
        dir - Directory
        targetPath - Path
        Returns:
        Directory

      • moveFileToSubdir

        public static java.io.File moveFileToSubdir(java.lang.String filename,
                            java.lang.String path,
                            java.lang.String subdirName)
        BilderHerunterlader provides options, where the user can set, that files of a specific size-range should be moved to a specific subdirectory. So this method moves the file. The method will check if there is already a file of same name existing and if so, a number is added to the filename. This is done by call the createFile-Method. The method returns a File-Object which contains path and filename, of where the file was moved. If the file could not be moved null is returned.
        Parameters:
        filename - Filename
        path - Path
        subdirName - Name of the subdir
        Returns:
        File
        See Also:
        createDirectory(File, String)

      • moveFile

        public static java.io.File moveFile(java.io.File fileToMove,
                    java.io.File newPath)
        This method moves a file. The method will check if there is already a file of same name existing and if so, a number is added to the filename. This is done by call the createFile-Method. The method returns a File-Object which contains path and filename, of where the file was moved. If the file could not be moved null is returned.
        Parameters:
        fileToMove - Filename
        newPath - Path
        Returns:
        File
        See Also:
        createDirectory(File, String)

        Returns:
        Status

      • setStatus

        public void setStatus(int status)
        Attention: You should not use the method from other classes. It could produce errors if set while download is running are so on. I used this method only from other classes when reading them from the database, because if the program was crashed the object could have DOWNLOADING as status and that is terrible. Sets the status of the download Available states: Pic.SLEEPING Pic.WAITING Pic.DOWNLOADING Pic.COMPLETE Pic.FAILED Pic.FAILED_FILE_NOT_EXIST If the status-argument is not one of those, the method will not set anything! This method fires the statusChanged-Method on all listeners.
        Parameters:
        status - Status

      • setFixedLastModified

        public void setFixedLastModified(boolean fixedLastModified)
        Sets the last modified timestamp to be fixed. Only if this is set to true, the download-class will set the last modified timestamp on the file.
        Parameters:
        fixedLastModified - Fixed lastModified

        public void setTargetFilename(java.lang.String targetFilename)

      • isFixedTargetFilename

        public boolean isFixedTargetFilename()
        Returns if the filename is fixed or not
        Returns:
        the fixedTargetFilename
        See Also:
        setFixedTargetFilename(boolean)

      • setFixedTargetFilename

        public void setFixedTargetFilename(boolean fixedTargetFilename)
        Sets the filename to be fixed. So the download or the hostclasses are not overwriting it! Note: When adding URLs to BilderHerunterlader, then the filenames are most only grabbed from the URL. But maybe hostclasses has methods to restore the original filename or get a better one. If not, when the direct link is known by the download, the download-class could, grab a nicer filename, as the ones in the Download-Selection-Dialog. So a filename should only set to fixed, when a user changes the filename in the GUI.
        Parameters:
        fixedTargetFilename - Fixed filename
